Prerequisites for Creating Rules
Action resources: You must have resources already set up to specify as an action. The Events service invokes the action specified in the rule by delivering the event message to action resources, which can include topics , streams, or functions. Every rule must have at least one action. The Events service can invoke any of the following services by delivering an event message for processing: 

Notifications

questions.question_text: Which is NOT a supported SDK on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
B, and A for sure.
To push an Image to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry
1. Create an auth token for use with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry
2. Log in to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry from the Docker CLI
3. Pull a test image from DockerHub
4. Tag the image
5. Push the image to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry using the Docker CLI
6. Verify the image has been pushed to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry using the Console
https://www.oracle.com/webfolder/technetwork/tutorials/obe/oci/registry/index.html

questions.question_text:
You are building a container image and pushing it to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Registry (OCIR). You need to make sure that these images never get deleted from the repository.
Which action should you take? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
I will go with B.
In each region in a tenancy, there's a global image retention policy. The global image retention policy's default selection criteria retain all images, so that no images are automatically deleted.
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Registry/Tasks/registrymanagingimageretention.htm

Ans: D
Explanation: Use "Exempt Tags" in the "Global Image Retention Policy...if you want to PREVENT images from being deleted".
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Registry/Tasks/registrymanagingimageretention.htm

Most correct answer is B, D seems also to be correct however D is related to repositorie(s) and the question is related to the registry. B is the only option that would ensure across all repositories in the registy
Correct answer is D
the correct is B
Correct answer is D
correct ans is D

Correct answer D.


If you have manage permission on the tenancy, you can:

modify each region's own global image retention policy
create new custom image retention policies
modify the criteria of existing custom image retention policies
delete custom image retention policies

https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Registry/Tasks/registrymanagingimageretention.htm

comments.content: There isn't a TENANCY retention policy. There are Global retention policy for each Region.

discussion.content: B is the right answer

choices.C: In your compartment, write a policy to limit access to the specific repository.
choices.B: Set global policy of image retention to "Retain All Images".
choices.A: Create a group and assign a policy to perform lifecycle operations on images.
choices.D: Edit the tenancy global retention policy.
